page.title: 15THE VILLAGE OF UPPER HOPTON
page.content: {Upper Hopton} is a blend of "old and new". The population is approx.{986, divided into those who have lived there many years and a more mobile population in the new estate. The oldest building - {The Hall}- dates back to Tudor times, and {the village {school}for children aged 5 to 9 is lO5 years old. {The church}is picturesque, surrounded by numerous daffodils in Springtime. The indigenous population has taken time to welcome the new residents, but since the formation of a {Community Assoc.}the village is gradually coming to terms with the changed environment. There are no employment opportunities in the village apart from a few farms. Most people travel to{Leeds, Huddersfield, {Dewsbury or Manchester}for work. There is little unemployment, generally this is an affluent area.
